description: Education, training, and skills development programs for veterans

resources.title: Vocational Rehabilitation and Employment (VR&E / Chapter 31)
resources.description: VR&E helps veterans with service-connected disabilities prepare for, find, and maintain suitable employment. Services include vocational counseling, training, education, resume development, and job placement assistance.
resources.summary: Comprehensive job training and career support for veterans with disabilities.
resources.eligibility: Veterans with a service-connected disability rating of at least 10%, or a memorandum rating of 20%+ for active duty service members.
resources.how_to_apply: Apply online through VA.gov or contact your local VA Regional Office.

resources.title: GI Bill Benefits (Post-9/11 and Montgomery)
resources.description: The GI Bill provides education benefits to veterans and service members for college, graduate school, technical training, licensing, certifications, and apprenticeships. Benefits include tuition, housing allowance, and books stipend.
resources.summary: Tuition, housing, and stipends for college and vocational training.
resources.eligibility: Veterans with qualifying active duty service. Post-9/11 requires 90+ days after September 10, 2001.
resources.how_to_apply: Apply online through VA.gov using VA Form 22-1990.

resources.title: ApprenticeshipUSA - Veterans
resources.description: ApprenticeshipUSA connects veterans with registered apprenticeship programs that combine on-the-job training with classroom instruction. Many programs accept GI Bill benefits, and veterans earn while they learn.
resources.summary: Registered apprenticeships combining paid work with GI Bill-eligible training.
resources.eligibility: All veterans, with priority for those using GI Bill or VR&E benefits.
resources.how_to_apply: Search the Apprenticeship Job Finder for opportunities and apply directly to employers.
resources.cost: Free to apply; earn wages during training

resources.title: VetTech Program
resources.description: VetTech provides tuition funding for veterans to attend coding bootcamps and high-tech training programs. The program covers the full cost of approved bootcamps with no GI Bill usage required.
resources.summary: Free coding bootcamps and tech training for veterans (no GI Bill required).
resources.eligibility: Veterans with at least one day of unexpired GI Bill entitlement (but does not use your GI Bill benefits).
resources.how_to_apply: Apply through VA.gov and choose from approved training providers.

resources.title: SkillBridge Program
resources.description: DoD SkillBridge provides transitioning service members with opportunities to gain civilian work experience through internships, apprenticeships, and training with industry partners during their last 180 days of service.
resources.summary: Civilian internships for transitioning military during last 6 months of service.
resources.eligibility: Active duty service members within 180 days of separation with command approval.
resources.how_to_apply: Work with your command and transition office to find and apply to SkillBridge programs.

resources.title: Onward to Opportunity (O2O)
resources.description: O2O provides free career training, certifications, and job placement for transitioning service members, veterans, and military spouses in high-demand fields including IT, business, and customer service.
resources.summary: Free industry certifications and career training in high-demand fields.
resources.org_name: Syracuse University - Institute for Veterans and Military Families
resources.eligibility: Transitioning service members, veterans of all eras, and military spouses.
resources.how_to_apply: Apply online at the O2O website to access free training tracks.

resources.title: Helmets to Hardhats
resources.description: Helmets to Hardhats connects veterans with careers in the building and construction trades through apprenticeships. The program works with building trade unions to place veterans in well-paying skilled trade careers.
resources.summary: Construction trade apprenticeships connecting veterans with union careers.
resources.eligibility: Veterans interested in careers in the building and construction trades.
resources.how_to_apply: Register online and complete a profile to be matched with opportunities.
